title: Sharon Horgan gives update on Catastrophe future after shock series 4 ending
text:
Sharon Horgan and Rob Delaney in Catastrophe (Picture: Channel 4)

Sharon Horgan has teased the possibility of a return to her hit show Catastrophe in the future.

We’re relieved to hear it after that very ambiguous ending back in February…

The hit Channel 4 show – which also starred Deadpool 2’s Rob Delaney – focused on a middle-aged couple also called Sharon and Rob navigating unexpected parenthood.

The fourth and final series ended with the pair swimming in the sea after Rob’s mother’s funeral. (The character, Mia, was played by the late Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher, and the episode was a tribute to her).

Speaking to Digital Spy, Sharon – who also created the show – admitted returning to the characters when they’re older could prove to be ‘fertile’ ground.

‘We often talked while we were filming about the idea of revisiting those characters. This was before we knew it was going to end,’ she said.

‘We talked about revisiting them and they’re that bit older and their kids are at a different stage where a whole new set of challenges come along, because there’s only so many times you can watch people with small kids flail.’

Sharon and Rob: oh, the laughs they gave us… (Picture: Channel 4)

She finally added: ‘I guess getting that bit older and your kids being older and all the anxieties and new problems that come with that, that’s fertile ground. But I don’t know. It depends if they made it back to the shore or not I guess.’

Please tell us they did, Sharon!

The actress is also known for the 00s comedy series Pulling, and for creating the HBO series Divorce, starring Sex and the City’s Sarah Jessica Parker.

The talented lady recently wrote and directed an episode of Modern Love, the romantic Amazon Video series which stars the likes of Anne Hathaway, Tina Fey and Dev Patel.
